intro: Moraea flexicaulis, commonly known as the bent-stem moraea, is a species of flowering plant in the Iridaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in grassland and rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, often curved stems and clusters of delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It blooms during the spring and summer months, adding ornamental value to gardens and natural landscapes. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated for both horticultural and conservation purposes.
